Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2010 12:29PM my3sonz wrote: Big giant bear hugs from this newbie!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Carol
Posts.Title: Progression in liver and bones :-( konakat dreamwriter

Posts.Content: my3sonz wrote: Hi, I have previously posted that I was recently diagnosed with lung mets.  Last Friday I started TCH which will be every three weeks.  I feel terrible and am an emotional mess.  I've been in bed since Sunday and am so weak.  I'm really questioning everything.  Do I want to live like this?  I can't even be a mother to by boys.  Is this all I have to look forward to, feeling like constant crap?  Please, someone tell me it gets better than this, because this isn't living.  I have no appetite and am just weak and miserable.  Sorry to whine but I just have to say it somewhere. Carol Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Feel like hell my3sonz getwell

Posts.Content: my3sonz wrote: I was wondering if anyone else is dealing with a spouse that just couldn't care less about your illness?  I've been dealing with this since I was first diagnosed as stage 3 in 2006 and it just gets worse.  My husband told me then that my cancer diagnosis is God's punishment because I am a bad person.  Now, that I am a stage 4 all he does is sit on the computer when he is home.  He constantly tells me I should be doing more work around the house.  I work full time and am doing treatment, in the past week I have had a kidney stone removed and a lung biopsy and worked.  If I ask him to do ANYTHING he is f this, f that, f you.  I discovered last week that he has been corresponding with an "old friend" and texting and talking on his cell sometimes more than fifty times a day.  I busted him and called her up and yet I check my account and he is STILL doing it.  I would make him leave, would have over three years ago, but can't afford it financially.  I have nightmares several times a week about dying and my kids.  I'm just wondering if anyone else is dealing with someone that just doesn't care?  How do you deal with it?  I'm already tired. Carol Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2010 01:01AM my3sonz wrote: Thanks, Paula, I talked to my chemo nurse yesterday.  I am feeling broken today.  I love my kids so much and feel like I can't do this and will be leaving them soon.  I'm such a mess today.
Posts.Title: Feel like hell my3sonz getwell

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2010 01:30AM my3sonz wrote: Sad part is I take meds for depression and anxiety and have turned into such a mess.  Today I just broke down when I stood at the door watching my 8 yo go off to school.  I just broke and can't get it back together again.  I've been through the full treatment for this monster three years ago and now I am back again.  I have called my onc nurse again this morning but that is usually an all day thing trying to hear back from their office.  Thanks everyone for the kindness. Carol
Posts.Title: Feel like hell my3sonz getwell

Posts.Content: my3sonz wrote: Hi, I hope I am doing this right....so here goes.  My name is Carol, I am 44 yrs old and live in Tulsa, OK.  I am married and have three boys, 14, 11 and 8 yo.  I was diagnosed with IBC er/pr neg, her pos in October, 2006.  I did 4 rounds of epirubicin and cytoxin (not sure of spelling) and then 4 rounds of taxol and herceptin followed by the year of just herceptin.  I also had 36 rounds of radiation and bi-lat mastectomies.  I was doing great and feeling good when bam, at a routine chest x-ray something suspicious was showing.  I then had a ct scan and lung biopsy which determined I have two masses in my left lung.  I did a loading dose of herceptin on the 18th, will do a pet scan this week and another herceptin on the 31st and then on the 8th will start off with carboplatin, taxotere and herceptin.  I think maybe I am still in shock or denial or something and am trying to hold it together for my kids.  I'm trying not to look at the "big" picture and just focus on the here and now.  Not so easy to do at times. I have some questions, please tell me how any of you have tolerated this chemo combo?  I am soooo dreading going through it again but know there's no escaping it.  I work as a reading tutor in an elementary school and want to try to keep working, I love my job (well, most days), my onc said if I feel like it I can still work but to really be cautious due to all of the little germ carriers. I'm just not ready to give up and take this.  I'm p.o.ed that cancer has to show its ugly face once again.  I feel guilty that I am robbing my boys of a childhood that doesn't involve a sick mother and I may not be there for them soon.  So, please give me any info anyone has, I would really appreciate it!  I've been pouring over this forum and need to hear from others that "get it". Carol Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New and have questions my3sonz my3sonz

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2009 11:04AM my3sonz wrote: Thanks everyone for the welcomes and advice.  I went yesterday and had a pet scan done but won't see my onc until the 8th for the results.  I go back to school next week and I think I will go this weekend and get my hair cut really short so the hair loss won't be such a shock to the kids at school (my kids are veterans at having a bald mom).  I guess I will go hat shopping this weekend, I had a wig last time that I hardly used, it was so uncomfortable and my youngest son was terrified of it.  Not gonna waste my money this go around. I so hope I can keep working, I love my job so much and am afraid if I have to stay home that I will spend so much time thinking about my illness that it will really bring me down. Carol
